arm_group.description: The initial stage of the program consists of a health-behavior seminar and six weeks (twice a week for 90 minutes) of supervised endurance exercise (i.e. (?) jogging, nordic walking, cycling or swimming) in groups. In the second phase of the program, the participants receive a recommendation to continue exercise regularly unsupervised for one year, and receive monthly supervised exercise training sessions.

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: The impact of demographic changes on workplace has increased the importance of
      effective occupational preventive health programs. The primary goal of these programs is the
      improvement of overall health status (and therefore increase productivity and decrease
      healthcare costs) of the increasingly older workforce through positive lifestyle behavior
      change.

      A one- year preventive health behavior-change program for the employees of the company
      British Petrol (BP) shall be scientifically evaluated. The initial stage of the program
      consists of a health-behavior seminar and six weeks (twice a week for 90 minutes) of
      supervised endurance exercise (i.e. jogging, nordic walking, cycling or swimming) in groups.
      In the second phase of the program, the participants receive a recommendation to continue
      exercise regularly unsupervised for one year, and receive monthly supervised exercise
      training sessions. Clinical check-ups are performed at baseline (V1) at three months (V2)
      and at 12 months (V3).

clinical_study.brief_title: MOVING - MOtiVation, INtervention and Vascular chanGe

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will investigate the effect of one year of participation in a lifestyle-
      intervention- program on the participants' metabolic risk profile,  exercise capacity and
      vascular health. A primary focus is on the endothelium, because poor endothelial health is a
      risk factor and prognostic indicator of atherosclerosis and cardiovascular events.

      Hypothesis: One year of participation in endurance exercise (twice a week for 90 minutes)
      may positively influence endothelial health (RHI)

      The primary aim:

      change in endothelial function (reactive hyperemia index (RHI)) after one year.

      Secondary aims:

      Changes in other vascular parameters (AI: augmentation index, CAVI: Cardio ankle vascular
      index, ABI: ankle brachial index ), changes in anthropometric, inflammatory and metabolic
      parameters, exercise capacity (Watt/kg), physical activity, and health related quality of
      life (HRQoL).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Employees of the company British Petrol (BP) in Lingen, Germany

          -  men and woman of all age

          -  approval for being able to participate in physical activity

          -  existing, written agreement to study-participation with prior, detailed education

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute or chronic disease of any kind, which does not allow participation in physical
             activity (missing approval of being able to participate in physical activity)

          -  Incompetent patient, who is not able to understand character, meaning and
             consequences of the study

intervention.description: The initial stage of the program consists of a health-behavior seminar and six weeks (twice a week for 90 minutes) of supervised endurance exercise (i.e. jogging, nordic walking, cycling or swimming) in groups. In the second phase of the program, the participants receive a recommendation to continue exercise regularly unsupervised for one year, and receive monthly supervised exercise training sessions.

secondary_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in exercise capacity (Watt/kg) at 12 month
Vascular function: Change from baseline in CAVI (Cardio ankle vascular index) at 12 month
Changes from Baseline in systolic/diastolic blood pressure, weight, body-fat and waist-circumference at 12 month
Change from baseline in blood glucose, HbA1c, total cholesterol, HDL, LDL, triglycerides (metabolic parameters) and C-reactive protein (inflammatory parameters)at 12 month
secondary_outcome.measure: Inflammatory and metabolic parameters from blood samples (see description)

secondary_outcome.description: Vascular function: Change from baseline in AI (Augmentation Index) at 12 month
Vascular function: Change from baseline in ABI (Ankle-Brachial-Index)at 12 month
